problem: Currently EMRs display too much information on the screen. This can overwhelm the user, the physician, by making all data have equal visual weight.
solution: Create a more welcoming display that allows important information to be more prominent and less relevant information to be tucked away neatly. The improvement in user experience for physicians will lessen stress and burnout.

featuresTagline: Our dashboard is guided by principles of design to present information in a smarter way. Important information is visually prominent and less important information is accessible but tucked away.

features.description: Hover to display recent data points
features.explanation: There is less visual information displayed making relevant information easier to find
features.example: Hover over blood pressure will display last 5 blood pressures

features.explanation: Seeing irrelevant patient data can be overwhelming and cause confusion. Filtering data by categories will allow the user to see only what is relevant in context.
features.example: Limiting data to all recent rx's & imaging test results

features.description: Visually display changes in data points
features.explanation: Change in patient data is very important. A user should be easily able to see marked change in some data point
features.example: RX changes from 5mg to 10mg on May 1. This is highlighted.
